Not easy to stop, but we caught a ride to Vagamo within 20 minutes.
An older lady took me to Lindenes fyr and then back to the main road to Stavanger.
took quite some time to get a ride to Mandal, but its a nice spot with a busstop for cars to pull over
Its not that good

a perfect spot to Stavanger. Honestly I don't find on the map where it is exactly, but somewhere here. If you come form Kristiansand, take the bus 40 from the Centrum and get off the stop called Mjåvann, and stay in the busstop. It't just perfect. Good traffic, place for cars to stop etc. I waited 2 minutes and got a direct ride to Stavanger. Be avare that the bus 40 runs once in an hour or weekends even less times. Check for the bus schedule: http://agder.websrv02.reiseinfo.no/AgderIISSTaticTab
Many traffic, late afternoon, everybody was heading home after work but nobody stopped, waited one hour until a Norwegian lady brought me to the ferry!
Good spot for getting to Oslo, Førde and deeper into Sogn og fjordene.
Waited less than 5 minutes, lots of traffic and enough space for the cars to stop
mostly local traffic
Bus stop right after the traffic lights
Far too much local trafic. I got nothing  and waited at least 90 minutes
A bus stop. Going West towards Notodden/Bergen. Is between two round-about so cars are going slow. And a gas station behind. I had with skies and a big backpack and it to 10 min to get a hike.
I think there was too much local traffic here, i only got one offer to go a short distance.
nice place to hitchhike to odda. straight road with a bus stop. many cars on this road.
Way too fast from the highway, not very visible though a good place to stop. Had to buy a truck driver a drink to get a ride to someplace better

Afternoon, waiting time 80 mins, a 109km ride to Hamar, but I jumped off at a gaz station 20 km before Hamar, which is the best decision when you head up to Trondheim.
As I always say about this Shell Gaz station - be patient and friendly filter out short local rides if you go far north.

I love this Gas station, many cars stop there. I used a sign and my thumb. You should filter out short distance rides, just be patient and wait for a longer ride.
Heading to Trondheim, waiting time 30 mins, a 266 km ride to Otta.
The traffic was quite high despite the Christmas period. Got offered rides to the airport. After 2 hours of waiting got a ride to Lilllehammer
Arrived in August late on a saturday evening, 7PM. Tried for two hours for a ride north to Dal or Espa, then gave up and took a ride to the airport. Frequency was low. I talked to people.

A couple people who couldnt see the sign properly pulled over, but then weren't going to Tromsø. Most people ignored. You might have more luck hitching to the road junction further North then hitching again across to Tromsø. The bus to Tromsø does stop here, so it's a good spot to attempt if you've got nothing else to do.
No-one stopped people didn't seem nice. A lady in a van got me back to the station where there was an emergency bus going to absiko since there was a snow storm
A lot of traffic, need to wait a while tho

You are visible here from a decent distance and drivers have a bit more time to make a decision.
Note that there are no reasonable spots after this one if you want get north over the bridge

Dir: north, summer 
Seems like a good spot, waited two hours with no one stopping so I just took the last bus to tromsø. Although I did start at 2pm, would probably have better luck earlier.

2025 UPDATE: It's now an awefull spot. 

I believe they rebuild the road and there is no place to pull over anymore. 


It will eventually work thought, got a ride to Tromsø in 25". Staying  in the middle of the crossroad is an option, safer, but you get only the ppl coming from senja the.
We only waited 10 mins for a ride to Tromsø. Try on the road and asking people in the gas station.
Dir: South. Some cars pass by here, easy to pull over or to ask people in the gass station.
Dir: North. At least in the winter there is not a lot of room for cars to stop, but they do anyway. There is a gas station on 855.
Good sum up from the previous Hitchhiker: good if you can ask on the ferry, i did, 3 ppl refuse, at the end i stand at the exit fro classic method and got a ride to Narvik.

Dir: north, summer.
I made the mistake of not asking for rides on the ferry. All traffic has to come through the ferry, meaning you have a shot at one boatload of cars every 45 mins. I got lucky and got a ride to Narvik, from the first ferry that came.

There is a cycle of person arrriving and leaving here. I don't know what's the best time, but i was there at 6pm and noone was leaving the place. 

Maybe 4 / 5pm is good, when people finish Galdopingen.
For me it was a good spot. Plenty of people stopping there and a man took me as far north as he was driving before he turned into his village.
Not a good spot at 7 am, lots of cars coming here are just going to shop and then back to the city. This gas station doesn’t seem to be used a lot by cars going up north

Sign : Drammen

To Drammen

Most of the people are going to the suburbs
I waited for at least an hour at the entrance to the gas station, but standing on this triangle at the exit got me a ride west fairly quickly
tried for 30min. many cars but no one stopped. took the train in the end
Going to Larvik, it was a bus stop and lots of people passing by

Excellent spot, asked the basically only car there and he brought me over 3 hours up north (which was a very nice change considering how many cars I took to barely get halfway to Bodø). If you’re not that lucky you might have to wait a lot longer as there’s basically no cars

This a tiny town with nothing going on. Very light traffic, so we got stuck there for two days... BUT the gas station employees gave us food, the dumpster behind the store are full of food and there's a nice park you camp in and no one will bother you :)
There were not many cars in September, people going back mainly in the late afternoon. Maybe there are better chances on the main road.
The mountain trail starts here. Traffic is not intense (a car every 10-15 minutes)

The spot is a decent alternative when it's dark outside and no traffic at the gas station if someone is heading north. There is a lamp and a place where cars can easily pull over. The only issue is that cars go downhill so the driver doesn't have time to react after spotting you.

It was 6 am, during winter, dark outside and traffic was very low. Got a ride after 15 minutes of waiting to Berkåk although the driver had to turn back for me as he didn't have time to react in time.
Stood here for an hour going south to Oslo. A good spot going by an old gas station. So was just unlucky it took so long i think.
I stay here without sign and get ride to Lillehammer for 10 min.

Not a good place, there's not anymore place to pull over. We had luck, when we were going to the southern roundabout, a couple picked us up to Åsen on a random street. The comment from 2013 was right, not a good spot anymore. You could try your chance in the gas stations nearby.

Direction: north

I hitchhiked from here and it was pretty ok. There was a lot of space to pull out. But that's probably going to change soon as they are building new road there.
this map might be old, because there is a slip-road to the E6 highway that goes north. so go there and a car will stop in no time.
Good place with plenty of space to stop, but had to wait for a while.
I asked the store owner for some free food. He´s a kinds guy a gave me some bread an chease
Waited here for a long time, most of the cars are families With full cars, finaly two ladies stopped after more than 2 hours
big empty parking lot in front of a little store. still took me a while to get a ride to the nearby odda... anxious locals
